segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 5

segments.pli: 15. Tikaṇḍakīvagga
segments.en: 15. At Tikaṇḍakī

segments.pli: 144. Tikaṇḍakīsutta
segments.en: 144. At Tikaṇḍakī

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sākete viharati tikaṇḍakīvane.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāketa, in Tikaṇḍakī Wood.

segments.pli: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,

segments.pli: “bhikkhavo”ti.
segments.en: “Mendicants!”

segments.pli: “Bhadante”ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.
segments.en: “Venerable sir,” they replied.

segments.pli: Bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said this:

segments.pli: “Sādhu, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kālena kālaṃ appaṭikūle paṭikūlasaññī vihareyya.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a mendicant would do well to meditate from time to time perceiving the following:

segments.pli: appaṭikūle paṭikūlasaññī vihareyya.
segments.en: the repulsive in the unrepulsive,

segments.pli: Sādhu, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kālena kālaṃ paṭikūle appaṭikūlasaññī vihareyya.
segments.en: the unrepulsive in the repulsive,

segments.pli: Sādhu, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kālena kālaṃ appaṭikūle ca paṭikūle ca paṭikūlasaññī vihareyya.
segments.en: the repulsive in both the unrepulsive and the repulsive, and

segments.pli: Sādhu, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kālena kālaṃ paṭikūle ca appaṭikūle ca appaṭikūlasaññī vihareyya.
segments.en: the unrepulsive in both the repulsive and the unrepulsive.

segments.pli: Sādhu, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kālena kālaṃ paṭikūlañca appaṭikūlañca tadubhayaṃ abhinivajjetvā upekkhako vihareyya sato sampajāno.
segments.en: A mendicant would do well to meditate from time to time staying equanimous, mindful and aware, rejecting both the repulsive and the unrepulsive.

segments.pli: Kiñca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu atthavasaṃ paṭicca appaṭikūle paṭikūlasaññī vihareyya?
segments.en: For what reason should a mendicant meditate perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive?

segments.pli: ‘Mā me rajanīyesu dhammesu rāgo udapādī’ti—
segments.en: ‘May greed not arise in me for things that arouse greed.’

segments.pli: idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu atthavasaṃ paṭicca appaṭikūle paṭikūlasaññī vihareyya.
segments.en: A mendicant should meditate perceiving the repulsive in the unrepulsive for this reason.

segments.pli: Kiñca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu atthavasaṃ paṭicca paṭikūle appaṭikūlasaññī vihareyya?
segments.en: For what reason should a mendicant meditate perceiving the unrepulsive in the repulsive?

segments.pli: ‘Mā me dosanīyesu dhammesu doso udapādī’ti—
segments.en: ‘May hate not arise in me for things that provoke hate.’ …

segments.pli: idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu atthavasaṃ paṭicca paṭikūle appaṭikūlasaññī vihareyya.
Kiñca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu atthavasaṃ paṭicca appaṭikūle ca paṭikūle ca paṭikūlasaññī vihareyya?
segments.en: For what reason should a mendicant meditate perceiving the repulsive in both the unrepulsive and the repulsive?

segments.pli: ‘Mā me rajanīyesu dhammesu rāgo udapādi, mā me dosanīyesu dhammesu doso udapādī’ti—
segments.en: ‘May greed not arise in me for things that arouse greed. May hate not arise in me for things that provoke hate.’ …

segments.pli: idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu atthavasaṃ paṭicca appaṭikūle ca paṭikūle ca paṭikūlasaññī vihareyya.
Kiñca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu atthavasaṃ paṭicca paṭikūle ca appaṭikūle ca appaṭikūlasaññī vihareyya?
segments.en: For what reason should a mendicant meditate perceiving the unrepulsive in both the repulsive and the unrepulsive?

segments.pli: ‘Mā me dosanīyesu dhammesu doso udapādi, mā me rajanīyesu dhammesu rāgo udapādī’ti—
segments.en: ‘May hate not arise in me for things that provoke hate. May greed not arise in me for things that arouse greed.’ …

segments.pli: idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu atthavasaṃ paṭicca paṭikūle ca appaṭikūle ca appaṭikūlasaññī vihareyya.
Kiñca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu atthavasaṃ paṭicca paṭikūlañca appaṭikūlañca tadubhayaṃ abhinivajjetvā upekkhako vihareyya?
segments.en: For what reason should a mendicant meditate staying equanimous, mindful and aware, rejecting both the repulsive and the unrepulsive?

segments.pli: ‘Sato sampajāno mā me kvacani katthaci kiñcanaṃ rajanīyesu dhammesu rāgo udapādi, mā me kvacani katthaci kiñcanaṃ dosanīyesu dhammesu doso udapādi, mā me kvacani katthaci kiñcanaṃ mohanīyesu dhammesu moho udapādī’ti—
segments.en: ‘May no greed for things that arouse greed, hate for things that provoke hate, or delusion for things that promote delusion arise in me in any way at all.’

segments.pli: idaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu atthavasaṃ paṭicca paṭikūlañca appaṭikūlañca tadubhayaṃ abhinivajjetvā upekkhako vihareyya sato sampajāno”ti.
segments.en: For this reason a mendicant should meditate staying equanimous, mindful and aware, rejecting both the repulsive and the unrepulsive.”

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.
